name: Jianping Zeng 0001
content: Jianping Zeng Jianping Zeng Tenure-track Assistant Professor School of Computing and Augmented Intelligence (SCAI) Arizona State University (ASU) 660 S Mill Avenue, Tempe, AZ 85281, USA Office: CTRPT 203-05 Google Scholar DBLP jpzeng (at) asu (dot) edu Biography I am a Tenure-track Assistant Professor of Computer Science and Engineering in the School of Computing and Augmented Intelligence (SCAI) at ASU since Fall 2025. Before that, I was a computer architecture researcher in the Samsung Memory Solutions Lab (MSL) with a Ph.D. degree in Computer Science from Purdue University under the guidance of Prof. Changhee Jung. Prior to joining Purdue University, I worked as a compiler engineer with focus on optimizing GCC and Clang/LLVM compilers at Alibaba Group, China. I will take on 1-2 PhD students to start in Fall 2026, focusing on hardware/software (i.e., Compilers, Runtime, OS, and Architectures) co-design for performance, reliability, and security issues. Please email me your CV, transcript, and English test report and submit your application [here] before December 31, if you are interested in working with me. If you are already an ASU graduate student in either CSE or EECE program and would like to work with me, please shoot me an email as well. Research At ASU, I lead the Phoenix Architecture and Compiler Exploration (PACE) Lab, focusing on compilers and computer architectures. Specifically, PACE lab aims to co-design compilers and computer architectures, driven by application-level demand, addressing performance, reliability, and security issues of computing systems including energy harvesting systems and data centers. My prior research work is typically published at top-tier venues in computer architecture, high-performance computing, and programming languages, e.g., ISCA, MICRO, ICS, and PLDI. News November 2025: Congratulations to Gan on Kagura accepted to HPCA 2026! October 2025: Invited to serve on the program committee (PC) of NVMW 2026 and ICS 2026 August 2025: Officially join the Arizona State University! August 2025: Invited to serve on the program committee (PC) of ASPLOS 2026 May 2025: Invited to serve on the program committee (PC) of CGO 2026 and HPCA 2026 April 2025: Congratulations to Gan on IPEX selected as Best Paper Candidate at ISCA 2025! March 2025: Our paper about performance analysis of Samsung CMM-H accepted to IEEE Micro Special Issue. Please keep in touch for the final copy. March 2025: IPEX accepted to ISCA 2025, congratulation to Gan. This is the pride of being a mentor! March 2025: Invited to serve on the program committee (PC) of LCTES 2025 March 2025: Invited to serve on the program committee (PC) of MICRO 2025 January 2025: Invited to serve on the program committee (PC) of CF 2025 November 2024: Invited to serve on the program committee (PC) of ICS 2025 November 2024: Invited to serve on the program committee (PC) of ISCA 2025 August 2024: I will be joining the Memory Solutions Lab at Samsung Semiconductor as a Computer Architect! July 2024: Invited to join the program committee (PC) of PPoPP'25 July 2024: LightWSP accepted to MICRO 2024, congratulation to Yuchen. This is the pride of being a mentor! June 2024: I successfully defended my thesis! April 2024: VeriPipe accepted to ICS 2024 March 2024: cWSP accepted to ISCA 2024 March 2024: Receive the Merit Recognition Award from the CS department at Purdue. Big thanks to the department and my advisor! February 2024: PPA is nominated as Memorable Paper Award Finalist at NVMW 2024! February 2024: 3 papers accepted to NVMW 2024 July 2023: RTailor accepted to RTSS 2023 July 2023: PPA and SweepCache accepted to MICRO 2023 March 2023: WL-Cache accepted to ISCA 2023. Thanks a lot to my collaborators. March 2023: I will join Memory Solutions Lab (MSL) of Samsung Semiconductor, Inc as a System Architecture Intern this summer. Feb 2023: One paper accepted to NVMW 2023 April 2022: One paper accepted to NVMW 2022 March 2022: One paper accepted to HPDC 2022 March 2022: I will join the Computing Technology Lab of Alibaba Group, US this summer as a Research Intern focusing on computer architecture.
